cdd987266446afa9.title: Analyst II or III, Retail Ops
cdd987266446afa9.desc:
Location: , Hybrid Remote, United States  Organization: CNE Gas Holdings, LLC  Job ID: 247580  Date Posted: Sep 22, 2023 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Job Description 
 Description   
 COMPANY OVERVIEW 
  As the nation's largest producer of clean, carbon-free energy, Constellation is a company purposely-built to meet the challenges of the climate crisis. Constellation has been the leader in clean energy production for more than a decade and we are growing our company and capabilities. Now, we're accelerating, speeding our low-carbon or no-carbon power to more people in more places, day and night, providing our customers and communities with options to buy, manage and use energy as part of their decarbonization mission. The race is on to confront the climate crisis and Constellation is ready to meet the challenge. Come join us as together we lead energy. 
  TOTAL REWARDS 
  Constellation offers a wide range of benefits and rewards, designed to help our employees thrive professionally and personally. In addition to highly competitive salaries, we offer a bonus program, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase program; comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits, including a robust wellness program; paid time off for vacation, holidays and sick days; and much more. 
 
  ANALSYT II:  Expected salary range of $63,000 to $70,000, varies based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits package that includes bonus and 401(k). 
  ANALSYT III:  Expected salary range of $70,200 to $78,000, varies based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits package that includes bonus and 401(k). 
    *****************This Retail Operations role can be filled at Analyst II or Analyst III Level. Please see minimum qualifications list below for each level*********************************** 
  PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITIONS 
  Constellation is seeking a qualified professional with proven experience and results to join our Retail Operations team as an Analyst II or Analyst III. These positions within Retail Operations are responsible for monitoring and executing day-to-day workflow activities while meeting service level agreements with internal and external customers. These positions are responsible for gaining a working knowledge in the assigned business function areas. These positions will directly collaborate with team members, project groups, Information Technology, and cross functional teams to support changing business needs 
    PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES 
 
 Ensure Effortless Customer Experience Performing Operational Duties (Operational Excellence):  Responsible for one or more of the following functions of the order to cash process: managing data used to ensure competitive pricing and accurate billing for customers while minimizing risk to Constellation; enrolling customers with the utility to ensure they have power or gas when needed; processing contracts and/or confirms to ensure SOX compliance; managing customer payments to ensure accurate posting of cash to customer accounts and accurate revenue recognition; timely 3rd party payments; address internal/external customer inquiries timely and accurately; vendor and system support.  (70% Analyst II, 50% Analyst III) 
 Problem Solving and Issue Resolution (Problem Solving / Analytics):  Exercise appropriate judgment and analytical abilities, leveraging subject matter experts when necessary, to investigate discrepancies in work processes. Take necessary actions to resolve issues and work with other functional teams as needed.  (10% Analyst II, 20% Analyst III) 
 Cross Functional Communications (Operational Excellence):  Review and communicate issues to team members, leads, management and stakeholders with emphasis on customer information. Initiate and foster collaboration with team members to ensure seamless customer support and knowledge transfer. Interface with internal and/or external customers in handling and resolving inquiries as needed. Proactively communicate workflow system or process concerns to avoid or fully remediate issues that cross multiple groups. Adopt and support change management activities.  (10% Analyst II, 10% Analyst III) 
 Projects, Improvements, and Innovation (Process Improvements/Projects):  Active participation in challenging the status quo to automate and improve processes through innovation, with focus and intent on creating sustainable solutions. Leverage knowledge and experience in working with project groups, Information Technology, and cross-functional teams for key deliverables. Execute test scripts for business processes, system enhancements and bug fixes as needed.  (5% Analyst II, 15% Analyst III) 
 Comprehension/Adherence of Policies and Controls (Operational Excellence):  Maintain an understanding of business, contractual, regulatory, and market/tariff policies and ensure assigned workflow processes are aligned. Ensure that all Sarbanes-Oxley (“SOX”) Key Controls and other company policies are followed.  (5% Analyst II, 5% Analyst III) 
 
 
   JOB SCOPE 
 
 Level and depth of supervisory duties:  None 
 Budget accountability, impact on asset management, and organization revenue:  Budget accountability for managing personal expenses 
 Level of independence, decision-making authority, or strategic planning accountability:  Works under direct supervision and follows standard procedures to accomplish assigned tasks. Resolves routine questions and problems and refers more complex issues to higher levels. Ability to work independently but recognize when assistance or guidance is needed. 
 Number of direct reports (Span of Control):  None 
 Total number of employees managed (direct and indirect):  None 
 Internal and external contact relationships:  Immediate team; other applicable teams within same commodity and same region/POD; external customers and brokers if applicable. 
 
  Qualifications   
 ANALYST II 
  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree with 2+ yrs work experience required; or 5+ yrs combination of education and relevant work experience 
 
 
  Strong computer background/experience, including Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) 
 
 
  Ability to communicate effectively and professionally, with internal and external parties as required. • Established analytical and problem-solving skills. 
 
 
  Customer service orientation, serving internal and external clients. 
 
 
  Excellent attention to details 
 
 
  Capable of working independently and as a team member. 
 
 
  Strong organizational and time management skills - ability to organize and prioritize a fast-paced, heavy workload. 
 
 
  Ability to adapt to changing markets, systems, and processes. 
 
 
  Ability to obtain and analyze data with general supervision and can reason through scenarios to suggest course of action or remediation. 
 
 
  Has acquired a high-level understanding of the group's overall processes, with process improvement in mind. (Challenge the status quo) 
 
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, Accounting, Finance, Management Information Technology or Supply Chain Management Prior experience in the retail energy industry and/or regulated energy industry 
 
 
  Prior experience in the retail energy industry using CRM and/or Order-to-Cash workflow systems 
 
 
  Working knowledge of UDC/ISO/LDC market EDI transactions 
 
 
  Intermediate skills in Microsoft Access and/or SQL database query development 
 
  ANALYST III 
  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree + 2 yrs work experience required; or 6+ yrs combination of education and relevant work experience  
 
 
  Minimum: Advanced computer background/experience, including Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)  
 
 
  Ability to communicate effectively and professionally, with internal and external parties as required.  
 
 
  Established analytical and problem-solving skills.  
 
 
  Customer service orientation, serving internal and external clients.  
 
 
  Excellent attention to detail.  
 
 
  Capable of working independently and as a team member.  
 
 
  Strong organizational and time management skills - ability to organize and prioritize a fast-paced, heavy workload.  
 
 
  Ability to adapt to changing markets, systems, and processes.  
 
 
  Ability to obtain and analyze data with general supervision and can reason through scenarios to suggest course of action or remediation.  
 
 
  Has acquired a high-level understanding of the group's overall processes, with process improvement in mind. (Challenge the status quo) 
 
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Management, Management Information Technology or Supply Chain management 
 
 
  Prior experience in the retail energy industry using CRM and/or Order-to-Cash workflow systems 
 
 
  Working knowledge of UDC/ISO/LDC market EDI transactions 
 
 
  Advanced skills in Microsoft Access and/or SQL database query development 
 
  EEO 
  At Constellation, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Whether you are an employee or applicant, you will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. 
  We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining, and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners, and communities. We support a workplace that ensures mutual respect, where everyone has the opportunity to grow and contribute at their greatest potential. Constellation will provide you the tools and resources to build and power a successful career. 
 
 GOVERNMENT 
  VEVRAA Federal Contractor

4e139ac43e899149.title: Business Analyst Principal
4e139ac43e899149.desc:
The Business Analyst (BA) champions the business and functional requirements throughout all phases of the project. This role will partner with the project manager, other business analysts, business stakeholders, product owners, and IT staff to support project delivery. The Business Analyst plays a key role in requirements definition and understanding, testing, training, and documentation throughout our products and projects. 
 
  Essential Duties and Responsibilities 
 
 
 
  Contributes to the intake process by interviewing project requestors, creating backlog items and documenting high-level scope, key deliverables, and benefits. 
  Participates in all phases of the project lifecycle (from project initiation through closure) 
 
 
  Partners with project managers, other business analysts, business stakeholders, and project owners to define project scope. 
 
 
  Contributes to the planning process with the Scrum Master and/or project manager to plan activities including requirements gathering/refinement, design reviews, SOP/work instruction development, training, and go-live. 
  Responsible for requirements gathering, refinement, documentation (user stories and acceptance criteria), and communication. 
  Serves as a liaison to internal IT staff and vendors to ensure understanding of requirements, including input into scope/design and SOW documents. 
  Reconciles requirements with deliverables from engineering staff (traceability), including but not limited to demos, POCs and test cases. 
  Participates in the solutions process. 
  Creates clear and actionable process flows. 
  Creates business requirement documents, user stories, use cases, and supporting diagrams including sequence diagrams as needed. 
  Develops work instructions, SOPs, and training materials as assigned. 
  Contributes to status updates (both written and verbal). 
  Supports continuous improvement efforts. 
  Other duties as assigned. 
 
 
 
  Business Analyst II, III and Principal 
 
  Mentors less experienced Business Analysts. 
  Assists in requirements management practices and principles. 
 
  Business Analyst III and Principal 
 
  Assists and/or leads in requirements management practices and principles. 
  Participates and/or provides product ownership. 
 
 
 
  Qualifications 
 
 
 
  Proficient in using SQL, Visio and Office Suite, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 
  10+ years of progressive experience, refines at a Master level. 
  Experienced and skilled at both Waterfall and Agile SDLC methodologies. 
  Strong technical aptitude, analysis, and problem solving skills. 
  Proven ability to capture actionable requirements in writing. 
 
 
  Team player, comfortable with fast-paced, changing environment and ambiguity. 
 
 
  Excellent organizational skills with the ability to concurrently participate in multiple projects, priorities, and deadlines. 
  Excellent presentation skills with the ability to lead productive group meetings both in person and via remote collaboration tools (WebEx, video conferencing, etc.). 
 
 
  Self-directed with strong personal initiative and accountability; ability to independently deliver against all job accountabilities. 
 
 
  Process development and implementation experience. 
  Healthcare experience; PBM exposure is a plus. 
 
 
  Work Environment / Physical Demands 
  This position is in a typical office environment which requires prolonged sitting in front of a computer. Requires hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate standard office equipment including operation of standard computer and phone equipment. May have occasional high stress when dealing with customers/clients. Some travel may be required. 
 
  EOE M/F/D/V

0f8ef6f9d9df6e8e.title: Business Analyst
0f8ef6f9d9df6e8e.desc:
Octo, an IBM company, is an industry-leading, award-winning provider of technical solutions for the federal government. At Octo, we specialize in providing agile software engineering, user experience design, cloud services, and digital strategy services that address government's most pressing missions. Octo delivers intelligent solutions and rapid results, yielding lower costs and measurable outcomes. 
  Our team is what makes Octo great. At Octo you'll work beside some of the smartest and most accomplished staff you'll find in your career. Octo offers fantastic benefits and an amazing workplace culture where you will feel valued while you perform mission critical work for our government. Voted one of the region’s best places to work multiple times, Octo is an employer of choice! 
 You… 
  As a  Business Analyst  at Octo, you will provide analytical support to a federal health agency, including technical design document creation, task coordination, change management analysis, meeting facilitation, analysis, planning, and more. 
  Us… 
  We were founded as a fresh alternative in the Government Consulting Community and are dedicated to the belief that results are a product of analytical thinking, agile design principles and that solutions are built in collaboration with, not for, our customers. This mantra drives us to succeed and act as true partners in advancing our client’s missions. 
  Program Mission… 
  This program provides a full range of IT support to a federal health agency, including software development, maintenance, and implementation services to accelerate and streamline operational and business functions. 
 
   
 Octo is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, protected veteran status, race, color, religious creed, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, sexual orientation/gender identity, age, or genetic information. Selected applicant will be subject to a background investigation. 
  Octo is an IBM subsidiary which has been acquired by IBM and will be integrated into the IBM organization. Octo will be the hiring entity. By proceeding with this application, you understand that Octo will share your personal information with other IBM affiliates involved in your recruitment process, wherever these are located. More Information on how IBM protects your personal information, including the safeguards in case of cross-border data transfer, are available here:   https://www.ibm.com/careers/us-en/privacy-policy/ ”. 
 
 
 Requirements... 
 
 Minimum of eight (8) years’ experience in leading business analysis for projects of similar scope, scale and complexity. 
 Experienced in establishing a well-defined product backlog with epics, user stories, and acceptance criteria. 
 Proficient in Agile and knowledgeable in SAFe. 
 Excellent communication and presentation skills. 
 Candidate must have competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, and Outlook. 
 Candidate must have experience and demonstrated ability to write clear and accurate technical design documents, end-user documentation, new investment proposals, project plans, workflows, and standard operating procedures (SOP), etc. 
 
 Years of Experience:  Minimum of eight (8) years Information Technology (IT) experience, for projects of similar scope, scale and complexity. 
  Education:  Bachelor's degree. 
  Location:  Remote within the United States. 
  Clearance : Must be able to obtain and maintain a Federal Public Trust Clearance.

a7224c84874c0216.title: Technical Business Analyst
a7224c84874c0216.desc:
Description 
  Technical Business Analyst (Remote) 
 
  Remote East Coast | Virginia Remote Preferred     Job Description:  ICF is seeking a Technical Business Systems Analyst. In this role, you will work with project managers, product managers, technical architects, internal SMEs, and clients to help define and organize business and technical requirements for products supporting electrification and energy efficiency programs. This involves interviewing stakeholders to help refine and maintain requirements and keep product documentation and artifacts up to date. In this role, you will also be responsible for creating task plans and monitoring task completion across multiple support teams. Candidates should be comfortable working on a software product development team following a Scrum development methodology. Candidates should be highly independent, driven to follow-up on tasks without prompting, and comfortable driving tasks through completion.     Why you will love working here: 
 
  Quality of life:  Flexible workplace arrangements, work-life balance 
  Investment of the community:  Donation matching, volunteer opportunities 
  Investment in you:  Tuition reimbursement, access to professional development resources, 401k matching, Employee Stock Purchase Plan 
  And many, many more  (Ask your recruiter for more details!) 
 
 
  What you will be doing: 
 
  Support meetings with stakeholders and prepare functional requirements documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, and user stories 
  Create stories and tasks in JIRA to support the execution of client deliverables 
  Work with and assist QA team to develop and implement test cases and acceptance criteria for releases 
  Support stakeholders through training, as well as one-on-one technical assistance 
  Support project delivery through task tracking and project management using project management tools. Create and maintain project task plans. Drive and monitor progress across internal support teams responsible for completing tasks 
 
 
  What we need you to have (minimum qualifications): 
 
  Bachelor's in (math, engineering, science, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field) and 
  5+ years’ experience in a business analysis or related field 
  3+ years' clearly defining and documenting business processes and software requirements 
 
 
  What we would like you to have: 
 
  Experience with Atlassian Jira and Confluence highly desirable 
  Experience working in the energy industry on energy efficiency and/or beneficial electrification projects is highly desirable 
  Experience with customer discovery and product development 
  Balances and prioritizes multiple workstreams to meet goals, deliverables, and deadlines 
  Works collaboratively and cohesively in a team environment 
  Participates in test script preparation and quality assurance activities 
  interest in Agile software development process and product ownership 
 
 
  Professional Skills: 
 
  Extremely well-organized with a high appreciation for details 
  Superior verbal and written communication skills 
  Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making capabilities 
  Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment 
  Resourceful and self-motivated 
  Excellent interpersonal skills including courtesy, professionalism, and a cooperative attitude 
  Exceptional attention to detail in communication and deliverables 
 
 
  Working at ICF 
  ICF is a global advisory and technology services provider, but we’re not your typical consultants. We combine unmatched expertise with cutting-edge technology to help clients solve their most complex challenges, navigate change, and shape the future.
  
  We can only solve the world's toughest challenges by building an inclusive workplace that allows everyone to thrive. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to hiring regardless of any protected characteristic, such as race, ethnicity, national origin, color, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability status, or military/veteran status. Together, our employees are empowered to share their expertise and collaborate with others to achieve personal and professional goals. For more information, please read our EEO & AA policy. 
 
  Reasonable Accommodations are available, including, but not limited to, for disabled veterans, individuals with disabilities, and individuals with sincerely held religious beliefs, in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please email icfcareercenter@icf.com and we will be happy to assist. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. Read more about non-discrimination: Know Your Rights and Pay Transparency Statement. 
 
  Pay Range  - There are multiple factors that are considered in determining final pay for a position, including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location, education and certifications as well as contract provisions regarding labor categories that are specific to the position. The pay range for this position is:  $77,412.00 - $131,600.00
   Virginia Remote Office (VA99)

75f8c8b1e043db90.title: Sr. Business Analyst (Business Analytics)
75f8c8b1e043db90.desc:
Summary  
 The Analyst, Business Sr Business Analytics is responsible for developing complex reporting with an understanding of current business processes and metrics as they relate to the mortgage industry. This includes gathering requirements, analyzing and mapping data, and complex report/database development. The Senior (Sr) Business Analyst Business Analytics must possess the necessary skills to work in conjunction with all areas of the business including, mid and senior level management as well as other analytics areas. 
 
  Essential Job Functions : 
 
  Performs the research and information gathering necessary to define, design, create, and document business requirements and specifications as it relates to the development of reporting solutions. 
  Develops SQL/Snowflake stored procedures, functions, views, tables and other database objects as defined by business partner requirements and to support overall corporate objectives. 
  Interfaces with business units to define business requirements. 
  Assists business units with designing and testing reports to solve business needs. 
  Plays a key role in educating the Business on reporting and analytics solutions. 
  Assists with technical project management activities as appropriate. 
  Works well both independently and as a team to define processes, coordinate work, and manage communications across the business. 
  Maintain and continuously seek to improve existing business partnerships. 
  Identifies and defines improvements to existing reporting data sources. 
  Manages and maintains current report catalog including automating manual reports as well as improvements to existing reports. 
  Creates and maintains documentation regarding reporting and associated data. 
  Manages reporting for additions, modifications or deletions to data and the reporting environment. 
  Fulfill ad-hoc data/reporting requests as needed. 
  Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
 
 
  Other Related Duties: 
  Performs other related duties as assigned. 
 
  Supervisory Responsibilities: 
  This position has no supervisory responsibilities. 
 
  Qualifications: 
  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job. 
 
  Education and/or Experience : 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Business Analytics or related field preferred. 
  Minimum five years of experience with Business Analytics experience, preferably in the mortgage or financial services industries. 
  Minimum five years of complex report development experience utilizing PowerBI, Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Tableau or similar report development software. 
  Experienced in generating KPI and executive dashboards. 
  Proven ability to think creatively in complex situations. 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
  Ability to juggle and prioritize multiple projects and tasks simultaneously. 
  Hands on experience gathering requirements, designing and creating new reports, maintaining and enhancing existing reports, as well as designing dashboards. 
  Must be flexible and comfortable in a fast changing environment where projects, priorities and timelines shift frequently. 
 
 
  Language Skills:  
 Ability to read and interpret documents such as policy and procedure manuals, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of the organization. 
  Mathematical Skills:  
 Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, and percentages. 
  Reasoning Ability:  
 Ability to solve practical problems and solve a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardizations exists. Ability to intemperate a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. 
 
  Customer Service Relationships: 
  Assesses and diffuses problem situations and requires influencing others to reach consensus. Requires tact and diplomacy to handle difficult customer relationships. Explores alternatives and creative solutions to meeting the needs of customers. 
 
  Work Complexity: 
  Tasks are multiple and diverse with some interrelationship across processes. Work requires the direct application of a variety of procedures, policies and/or precedents. 
  Work Environment:  
 Work is normally performed in a typical interior work environment which does not subject the employee to any hazardous or unpleasant elements. 
  Equal Employment Opportunity

e3997ba274a18f22.title: ServiceNow IT Service Management (ITSM) Analyst
e3997ba274a18f22.desc:
Synovize is a leading technology consulting firm that specializes in providing innovative solutions to businesses across various industries. With a team of experienced professionals, we aim to deliver exceptional services to our clients and help them achieve their digital transformation goals. As a remote-first company, we offer flexible work opportunities to talented individuals across the United States. 
 Overview: 
 We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced ServiceNow IT Service Management (ITSM) Analyst to join our team. As a ServiceNow ITSM Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing, designing, and implementing IT service management solutions using the ServiceNow platform. This is a full-time, permanent or contract position with the flexibility of remote work. 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to understand their IT service management needs and translate them into ServiceNow configurations. 
 Analyze existing IT service management processes and workflows, identifying areas for improvement and optimization. 
 Design and configure ServiceNow ITSM modules, including incident management, problem management, change management, and service catalog. 
 Customize ServiceNow functionalities using JavaScript, Angular, and other web technologies to meet specific client requirements. 
 Integrate ServiceNow with external systems through REST API, SOAP API, and other integration methods. 
 Develop and maintain the Configuration Management Database (CMDB) to ensure accurate and up-to-date data. 
 Conduct testing and quality assurance activities to ensure the stability and reliability of the implemented ITSM solutions. 
 Provide end-user training and support during and after the implementation process. 
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery within agreed timelines and budgets. 
 Stay updated with the latest ServiceNow features and enhancements, recommending and implementing improvements to optimize IT service management processes. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
 Proven experience as a ServiceNow ITSM Analyst, working on IT service management projects and configuring the ServiceNow platform. 
 Strong knowledge of IT service management processes and frameworks, such as ITIL. 
 Proficiency in JavaScript, Angular, and web technologies for customization and enhancement purposes. 
 Experience with integrating ServiceNow with external systems using REST API, SOAP API, and other methods. 
 Familiarity with the Configuration Management Database (CMDB) and data management best practices. 
 Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical solutions. 
 Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with clients and cross-functional teams. 
 
 Preferred Skills: 
 
 ServiceNow certifications such as Certified Implementation Specialist or Certified Application Developer. 
 Knowledge of ITIL best practices and their application in ServiceNow. 
 Experience with other ServiceNow modules such as GRC, HAM, SAM, APM, and SPM. 
 Familiarity with NoSQL databases and their usage in ServiceNow. 
 Experience with ITOM, SCCM, JAMF, or other related tools and technologies. 
 
 To apply for the position of ServiceNow IT Service Management (ITSM) Analyst at Synovize, please submit your resume and any relevant certifications. We are excited to hear from talented individuals who are passionate about leveraging the power of ServiceNow to drive efficient IT service delivery. Join us in shaping the future of technology consulting! 
 Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent 
 Pay: $60.00 - $100.00 per hour 
 Benefits: 
 
 401(k) matching 
 Dental insurance 
 Disability insurance 
 Flexible schedule 
 Flexible spending account 
 Health insurance

 Life insurance

 1099 contract

 Application Question(s):

 Do you have any ServiceNow Certifications? If so, were they paid out of pocket? 
 
 Experience: 
 
 ServiceNow: 2 years (Required) 
 
 Security clearance: 
 
 Secret (Preferred)

6a443a2e32141daa.title: Revenue Analyst
6a443a2e32141daa.desc:
Summary:   As a Revenue Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing financial data and identifying key trends to maximize revenue for the company. Your role will involve developing and implementing revenue strategies to optimize profitability, as well as providing valuable insights to support decision-making across the organization. Support the CRO and senior management identifying the most critical  issues and actions to be taken to achieve results. If you have a strong analytical mindset and a passion for maximizing revenue growth, then this role could be the perfect fit for you. As a Revenue Analyst, you will have the opportunity to play a critical role in driving the financial success of the company.     Duties / Responsibilities:   
 
 Analyze financial data to identify trends and opportunities for revenue growth 
  Develop and implement revenue strategies to maximize profitability  
 Monitor revenue performance and provide regular reports to senior management 
  Collaborate with other departments to identify cross-selling and up-selling opportunities 
  Develop pricing strategies and conduct pricing analysis to optimize revenue  
 Conduct market research to identify new revenue streams and opportunities  
 Provide support to sales teams to ensure that revenue targets are achieved  
 Utilize various software applications and tools to compile and analyze data  
 Communicate with internal stakeholders to ensure a cohesive approach to revenue management  
 Participate in financial planning and forecasting activities 
  Develop dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate key performance metrics and insights to stakeholders  
 Identify and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and programs. 
  Conduct competitor analysis to identify market trends and opportunities for growth. 
  Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and implement data-driven strategies that improve customer acquisition, retention, and engagement. 
 
  Required Qualifications: 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in Business or a related field 
  2+ years of experience in revenue analysis or a similar role  
 Experience working in a multi-product SAAS/Software company 
  Understanding of financial statements and accounting principles 
  Understanding of financial statements and accounting principles 
  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  
 Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial analysis tools  
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team  
 
 Preferred Qualifications: 
 
  Master’s degree in Business or related field. 
  5+ years of relevant experience. 
  Experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI) as well as Salesforce and Sage Intacct 
  Well-equipped to drive the Company’s growth as the Company continues to increase in scale and complexity.  
 Experience in a middle market business or otherwise highly entrepreneurial to develop, sell, enable and maximize revenue growth. 
 
  Normal Working Hours and Conditions:  Core business hours are generally 8:00 am – 5:00 pm. However, this position will require work to be performed outside of normal business hours based on Company operations.  
 Physical Requirements:  Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting including verbally communicating, seeing and hearing to exchange information and fine coordination including use of a computer keyboard. Daily physical functions include standing, sitting and walking for prolonged periods of time and occasionally stooping, bending, kneeling, crouching, reaching, and twisting. The employee may engage in lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling light to moderate amounts of weight up to 25 pounds. The position also requires the operation of office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement.  
 Navigate360 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants due race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other legally protected status.

13fb649da534032d.title: Technical Writer/Business Analyst
13fb649da534032d.desc:
Your Impact: 
  Jacobs is seeking a highly motivated team member to fill the Business Analyst/Technical Writer role on our Documentation Team. The Documentation Team is an independent group that creates and maintains security processes and procedures for a Federal client. 
 As such, the team is tasked to manage the revision lifecycle of the documentation library, and maintain cybersecurity documents to ensure compliance with Federal policy and guidance set forth by Senior Leaders. 
 Candidates are expected to have a strong work ethic and possess the ability to work as a critical member of a team in pursuit of mission objectives and in support of our customer. We value detail-oriented candidates who can quickly respond to emerging tasks. To be successful in this role, you’ll be able to rapidly adapt to client demands and business processes. 
 
 
 The client is located in Washington, DC, but this work is 100% remote. 
   
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Provide analysis of both Cyber and Technical-related documentation of complex technology systems and their related compliance with government and agency policies and procedures. 
 Collaborate with government staff, technical staff, and project technical writers to ensure the highest professional degree of operational and user documentation is delivered to the customer. 
 Facilitate Kickoff Meetings (Annual Reviews) for documentation updates with a detailed agenda, recommended changes, and possible consolidation or retirement of documents. 
 Review and update complex system operational and user documentation. 
 Ensure all documentation, from whitepapers to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), are of the highest professional quality and ready for client distribution to technical and executive management. 
 Create, revise, and publish cybersecurity documentation on the client’s documentation library. 
 Manage and maintain a documentation schedule for assigned documents to track revision cycles and frequency. 
 Maintain a library of possible sources of updates and crosswalk with current security library to ensure compliance with new/existing Federal and Departmental policy. 
 Provide monthly documentation updates associated with new procedures, processes, policies, or other security related issues. 
 Maintain metrics associated with documentation updates, approval rates, timeliness, etc. 
 Provide monthly updates on upcoming revisions, overdue revisions, emergency updates, and trend statistics. 
 Create a variety of memos, reports, job aids, and/or checklists/forms for a wide range of uses. 
 Create/Edit visual graphics, including workflow diagrams, swim lane diagrams, charts, and/or briefings/presentations. 
 Manage, track, and follow-up on multiple documents (which vary in size, from 10 pages to hundreds of pages) simultaneously and create new documents as requested. 
 Support the development of all types of documents and reports by developing and updating written presentations to improve the quality and enhance the usability of these documents. 
 Produce visualizations (such as dashboard, charts, or graphs) that provide insights into process-improvements. 
 
   
 
 Here’s What You’ll Need: 
  Here’s What You’ll Need:  
 
 Must be able to obtain a High Risk/Public Trust Security Clearance 
 Must have good communication skills, both oral and written, and working familiarity with document editing, visual editing, and publishing tools 
 Bachelor’s degree 
 3-5 years in a Technical Writer role supporting technology projects and programs for Federal Government 
 Experience using graphics software (e.g., Microsoft Visio, Adobe Acrobat, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, etc.) 
 Strong working knowledge with MS Office Suite (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and SharePoint) 
 Strong English grammar, proofreading, copyediting skills, and familiarity with style guides 
 Ability to translate technical information to clear, readable documents to be used by technical and non-technical personnel 
 Ability to work in a team environment 
 Ability to manage multiple tasks under tight deadlines 
 Familiarity of the Federal Plain Language Act of 2010 
 
 
 
 Preferred:   
 
 Experience documenting technical enterprise software/systems implementations in a cloud-based operational environment 
 Experience creating Standard Operating Procedures, user manuals, job aids, and technical guides 
 Experience briefing senior-level stakeholders and/or managers 
 Proficient understanding of NIST Special Publications (e.g., SP 800-53, SP 800-137, SP 800-171, and SP 800-37). 
 Proficient understanding and application of the NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF). 
 
 
 
 Typical salary range for this position is  75,000 to 90,000  and is commensurate with experience relative to the position.

545f5f7300a6bbed.title: Remote - Business Analyst
545f5f7300a6bbed.desc:
Primary Location 
 :  United States of America-OHIO-Franklin County-Columbus
  
 
  Work Locations 
 :  James A Rhodes Office Tower 30 30 East Broad Street 30th Floor Columbus 43215
  
 
  Organization 
 :  Job & Family Services
  
 
  Classified Indicator 
 :  Classified
  
 
  Bargaining Unit / Exempt 
 :  Bargaining Unit
  
 
  Schedule 
 :  Full-time
  
 
  Work Hours 
 :  8:00 am - 5:00 pm
  
 
  Compensation 
 :  31.86 per hour
  
 
  Unposting Date 
 :  Sep 30, 2023, 10:59:00 PM
  
 
  Job Function 
 :  Human Resources
  
 
 
 
  Agency Contact Name 
 :  ODJFS - Human Resources
  
 
  Agency Contact Information 
 :  HR_Support_Center@jfs.ohio.gov
   
 
 
 
  Remote - Business Analyst  (230008XG)
   
 
 
 
  Job Duties 
 
 
  Who We Are 
  The Ohio Department of Job and Family Services (ODJFS) supports Ohioans and their families through the following programs: 
 
  Public Assistance 
  Workforce Development 
  Unemployment Insurance 
  Child Protective Services 
  Adult Protective Services 
  Adoption 
  Childcare 
  Child Support 
 
 Public service is an honorable way to serve the community in a hands-on dedicated way. You can make a difference in someone’s world! 
  Agency Mission 
  To improve the well-being of Ohio's workforce and families by promoting economic self-sufficiency and ensuring the safety of Ohio's most vulnerable citizens. 
  Our Vision 
  To be the nation's leading workforce development and family support system. 
  Our Values 
  Accountability, Innovation, Teamwork, Integrity, and Compassion  
 The Office of Families and Children (OFC) is responsible for state level administration and oversight of programs that prevent child abuse and neglect; provide services to abused/neglected children and their families (birth, foster and adoptive); license foster homes and residential facilities; and investigate allegations of adult abuse, neglect, and exploitation. Learn more about the office by visiting ODJFS OFC webpage. 
 
  What You’ll Do 
 
 
 
 
    The Business Analyst position assists in designing and supporting the case, financial and provider modules within Ohio SACWIS, the Ohio Residential Treatment Information System (RTIS), the Ohio Benefits (OB), Social Security Administration (SSA) and Child Support interfaces. The candidate will be creative, independent, detail-oriented, have the ability to learn and use new technologies as well as excellent communication and writing skills with the ability to translate policy into business requirements.
   
 
 
 
    Successful candidates will conduct research on business processes to define system needs, requirements and identify gaps and inconsistencies in the functionality. The candidate will complete analysis of system issues and work with the Office of Information Services (OIS) to: trouble shoot issues, complete system requirement documentation, facilitate/participate in meetings, workgroups and design sessions.
   
 
 
 
 
   The candidate will review and prioritize outstanding work items based on bureau goals and objectives, prepare and distribute reports and other communications, complete Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs) and other user guides, and prepare and deliver presentations before various audiences. Successful candidates will also participate in release/software testing and engage in post-deployment production user support activities.
   
  Residency/Other: 
 
 Residence:  Employees must reside in Ohio and/or within a reasonable distance of their assigned work location. If selected, you may be asked to travel to one of our locations to pick up equipment and receive initial instructions. 
 Schedule:  Working hours for this position are Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Flextime may be available. 
 Travel:  This is a remote position; however, you may be required to occasionally travel to locations within the State of Ohio for meetings and to perform job duties. 
 
 What’s in it for you: 
  At the State of Ohio, we take care of the team that cares for Ohioans. We provide a variety of quality, competitive benefits to eligible full-time and part-time employees. For a list of all the State of Ohio Benefits, visit our Total Rewards website! Our benefits package includes: 
  Medical Coverage 
 
 Quality, affordable, and competitive medical benefits are offered through the available Ohio Med plans. 
 
 Dental, Vision and Basic Life Insurance 
 
 Dental, vision, and basic life insurance premiums are free after completed eligibility period. Length of eligibility period is dependent on union representation. 
 
 Time Away From Work and Work/Life Balance 
 
 Paid time off, including vacation, personal, and sick leave 
 11 paid holidays per year 
 Childbirth/Adoption leave 
 
 Employee Development Funds 
 
 The State of Ohio offers a variety of educational and professional development funding that varies based on whether you are a union-exempt employee or a union-represented employee. 
 
 Ohio Public Employees Retirement System 
 
 OPERS is the retirement system for State of Ohio employees. The employee contributes 10% of their salary towards their retirement. The employer contributes an amount equal to 14% of the employee’s salary. Visit the OPERS website for more information. 
 
 Deferred Compensation 
 
 The Ohio Deferred Compensation program is a 457(b) voluntary retirement savings plan. Visit the Ohio Deferred Compensation website for more information. 
 
 Ohio is a Disability Inclusion State and strives to be a Model Employer of Individuals with disabilities. The State of Ohio is committed to providing access and inclusion and reasonable accommodation in its services, activities, programs and employment opportunities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and other applicable laws. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications 
 
 
  Completion of undergraduate core coursework or 2 years exp. in social or behavioral science, pre-medicine, business administration, public administration, human services as defined in series purpose, or comparable field (note: this required education and/or experience shall not be applied to satisfy one of the following), 
    
  AND
    
  In addition, must meet one of the following, whichever is pertinent to process automation project to be assigned:
    
  For Ohio Benefits System positions, requires 24 mos. recent exp. (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of human services that included explaining & applying public assistance laws, policies & procedures mandated by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services & using Ohio Benefits; 6 mos. trg. or 6 mos. exp. in operating personal computer & using Microsoft Office system software, that is Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package.
    
 
 
 Or for State Automated Child Welfare System (SACWIS) positions, requires 24 mos. recent exp. (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of human services that included explaining & applying child protective services laws, policies & procedures mandated by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services & using SACWIS; 6 mos. trg. or 6 mos. exp. in operating personal computer & using Microsoft Office system software, that is Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package. 
 
 
 
 Or for Support Enforcement Tracking System (SETS) positions, requires 24 mos. recent exp. (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of human services that included explaining & applying child support laws, policies & procedures & child support IV-D regulations mandated by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services & using SETS computer systems; 6 mos. trg. or 6 mos. exp. in operating personal computer & using office system software, that is Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package. 
 
 
 
 Or for Child Care Information Data System (CCIDS) positions, requires 24 mos. recent exp. (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of human services that included explaining & applying child care laws, policies & procedures mandated by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services & using CCIDS computer systems; 6 mos. trg. or 6 mos. exp. in operating personal computer & using office system software, that is Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package. 
 
 
 
 or for Medicaid Information Technology Systems (MITS) positions, requires 24 mos. recent exp. (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of health services that included explaining & applying health services laws, policies & procedures mandated by the Ohio Department of Medicaid & using MITS &/or MMIS; 6 mos. trg. Or 6 mos. exp. in operating personal computer & using Microsoft Office system software, that is Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package. 
 
 
 
 Or for position involving process automation project for another computer system, requires 24 mos. recent exp. (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of human services that included explaining & applying laws, policies & procedures mandated by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services that are pertinent to business work flows for which computer system is being designed & using human services legacy system such as Ohio Benefits, SACWIS, SETS, or CCIDS; 6 mos. trg. or 6 mos. exp. in operating personal computer & using office system software, that is Microsoft Office system software, that is Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package. 
 
 
  Note: This option requires the employing agency to develop and have position specific minimum qualifications approved by the Ohio Department of Administrative Services. 
  Tips For Your Application 
  When completing the different sections of this application, be sure to clearly describe how you meet the minimum qualifications outlined in this job posting. We cannot give you credit for your Work Experience and Education & Certifications if you do not provide that information in your online application. Information in attached resumes or cover letters must be entered into your application in the appropriate Work Experience or Education & Certification sections to be considered. 
  This position (Business Analyst, 20044171) is in the State of Ohio’s SEIU/1199 Schedule, Pay Range 31. Unless required by legislation or union contract, starting salary will be the minimum salary of that pay range (Step 1, currently $31.86 (per hour). These ranges provide a standardized pathway for pay increases. With continued employment, new hires move to the next step in the range after 6 months and annually thereafter.

  EEO Statement:  Ohio is a Disability Inclusion State and strives to be a Model Employer of Individuals with disabilities. The State of Ohio is committed to providing access and inclusion and reasonable accommodation in its services, activities, programs, and employment opportunities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and other applicable laws. To request an ADA reasonable accommodation, please email ADA_Public@jfs.ohio.gov.
   
 
 
 
  Telework Policy:  ODJFS may require occasional in-person meetings for training or other operational needs. You will have access to ODJFS shared workspaces, if needed. Employees are required to sign a teleworking agreement upon their first day. Schedules are subject to change based on the agency’s operational needs. Telework is considered a privilege and agreements are reviewed annually.
   
 
  This posting contains supplemental questions that will be used to assess proficiency in the minimum qualifications. Please provide complete, clear, and detailed responses to each question. Applicants must receive a minimum score of 70% of the total points possible for further consideration.

816dbdf5a0760cae.title: Vendor Management - Business Analyst (REMOTE)
816dbdf5a0760cae.desc:
Company Description
   At Xplor, we believe that helping people make the most of each day is the most rewarding way to spend ours. 
  We give small and medium-sized businesses cloud-based, intuitive technology solutions that enable them to manage all the hassles of running and growing a business, so business owners can get back to doing what they love. With Xplor Pay, we help businesses get paid quickly and securely – without hidden fees. We built the tech ourselves, and our platform delivers secure, transparent, fast, and accurate payments. 
  We are unified by our purpose of helping people to succeed. So, when you become part of our team, you also become part of the personal connection that strengthens the relationship people have with Xplor products. 
 
 
 
 Job Description
   JOB DESCRIPTION:  
 We are looking for a Vendor Management - Business Analyst to join our growing contract management team for our global organization. This role will be responsible for creating or reviewing business cases, sourcing and contract negotiations, while adhering to company procurement policies and procedures. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with vendors, legal, compliance, finance, and procurement teams, as well as a wide variety of key business stakeholders. 
  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 
 
  Work closely with key stakeholders and teams to create or review business cases and advise accordingly 
  Assist stakeholders with determining pricing and negotiating contracts 
  Drive the vendor onboarding, offboarding and monitoring processes to an efficient and successful completion, always in an automation/optimization mindset 
  Support the execution of third-party spend management and cost analysis 
  Vendor segmentation and alignment to the Product, I.T. and Payments business strategies 
  Perform vendor reviews to identify vulnerabilities or cost savings opportunities and create enhancement plans. 
  Improve and expand the existing internal database and data collection on third party vendors 
  Perform other related duties as assigned by management 
 
 
 The average base salary pay range for this position is $75k to $95k 
 May be considered for a discretionary bonus 
 
 
 
 
 Qualifications
   QUALIFICATIONS: 
 
  5 to 7 years professional experience in vendor analysis, contract management, or similar role 
  Bachelor's degree in business administration, accounting, finance, or equivalent experience in transaction processing industry vendor management preferred 
  Experience in the development of metrics and reporting 
  Knowledge of Vendor Risk methodologies, policies, standards and procedures 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
  Exceptional analytical skills with high attention to detail 
  Ability to work independently and as part of a team 
  Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority 
  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Products and database management tools 
  Must be able to travel as needed 
 
  COMPETENCIES: 
 
  Oral Communication- Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings. 
  Written Communication- Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information. 
  Planning/Organizing- Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic action plans. 
  Professionalism- Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments. 
  Integrity and Trust -Is widely trusted; Is seen as a direct, truthful individual; Can present the unvarnished truth in an appropriate and helpful manner; Keeps confidences; Admits mistakes; Doesn't misrepresent him/herself for personal gain. 
  Ethics and Values -Adheres to an appropriate (for the setting) and effective set of core values and beliefs during both good and bad times; Acts in line with those values; Rewards the right values and disapproves of others; Practices what he/she preaches. 
 
  Additional Information
   Values and Life at Xplor 
  Our four core values that guide us from how we hire and recognize our team members to how we interact with our customers day to day:    Make life simple  Build for people  Move with purpose  Create lasting communities    If these values sound like you, and describe people you want to work with, you will thrive at Xplor. 
  As an Xplorer, you will be part of a global network of talented colleagues who will support your success. We look for commonalities and shared passions and give people the tools they need to deliver great work and grow at speed. 
  Some of our perks and benefits are: 
 
  12 weeks Gender Neutral Paid Parental Leave for both primary and secondary carer 
  #GiveBackDays/Commitment to social impact – 3 extra days off to volunteer and give back to your local community 
  Ongoing dedication to Diversity & Inclusion initiatives such as D&I Council, Global Mentorship Program 
  Flexible time off 
  Access to free mental health support 
  Flexible work location agreements 
 
  Ready to apply? 
  To start your application, please submit your resume and we’ll be in touch as soon as we can. Please include the word "moonshot" at the top of your message to the Hiring Manager so that we know you took the time to read our job ad. 
  #LI-REMOTE 
 
  More about us 
  Xplor Technologies is a global platform integrating SaaS solutions, embedded payments, and Commerce Accelerating Technologies to help businesses succeed. Xplor provides enterprise-grade SaaS solutions for businesses in “everyday life” verticals: Childcare & Education; Fitness & Wellbeing, Field Services and Personal Services – and a global cloud-based payment processing platform. 
  Xplor Technologies serves over 78,000 customers that processed over $36 billion in payments, operating across 20 markets in 2022. 
  Good to know 
  To be considered for employment in the United States, you must be legally authorized to work in the US. Xplor does not sponsor visas, either at the time of hire or at any later time. 
  To learn more about us and our products, please visit www.xplortechnologies.com/us/careers. 
  We also invite you to check out our Candidate FAQs for more information about our recruitment process www.xplortechnologies.com/us/recruitment-faqs. 
  Xplor is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We're dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community. 
  All Information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. 
  Xplor is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Xplor will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact us via talent@xplortechnologies.com. 
  We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

60e10c4a50c9123e.title: Commercial Business Analyst (remote)
60e10c4a50c9123e.desc:
We’ve been providing financial solutions to individuals, families, and businesses throughout the Southeast for more than 100 years. Both companies were built on the same founding principles of relationship banking and investing in the communities we serve. It’s the commitment to these values that made us the strong and successful companies we are today and these values will guide us in the future. We invite you to consider joining our team. 
 
  SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES 
 
  It is the responsibility of the Commercial Business Analyst – Operations to take ownership of all tasks and challenges they encounter in the operation of their assigned position. The role is a critical support function of the Commercial Line of business requiring frequent interaction with Executive and Senior level management. It is both tactical and strategic in nature with significant collaboration within the LOB team as well as other departments of the bank including Marketing and Communication, Finance, and the Consumer Division. 
 
  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 
 
  Analyze and Develop Changes Process and Updates to the Commercial Line of Business pertaining to Compliance Regulations, specifically the 1071 ruling. 
 
  Compliance Risk Management in Partnership with Enterprise Risk and Business Risk Leaders to include Solutioning and Implementation changes resulting from Loan Review, Audit, and other areas where Risks could be identified. 
 
  Management and ongoing monitoring of Risk based projects such as Adverse Action 
 
  Evaluation of Exception Reporting Process which would have a significant impact on outstanding Risks. 
 
  Collaboration with Financial Intelligence Unit on Process Improvement and ongoing updates and changes based on new Commercial Bank Products 
 
  Partner with the Compliance Monitoring Group in relation to HMDA/CRA 
 
  Assist Commercial Client Services Manager role(s) with ongoing training and Lunch & Learns. 
 
  Collaborate and Assist with Commercial Operations Business Analyst role on Job Aids, Quick Reference Guides, Procedures, and Commercial End2End Project sponsored by Loan Operations (3-5 years of work). 
 
  Collaboration with other teams of the bank on projects, as needed: e., nCino, Loan Closing, Credit teams, Deposit Operations, Loan Operations. 
 
  Assure all confidential information is properly safeguarded in accordance with Bank policies. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential 
 
  COMPETENCIES 
 
  Proficient in MS Office 
 
  Strong banking knowledge 
 
  Advanced problem-solving and analysis skills 
 
  Superior oral and written communication skills 
 
  High level of organization and detail-orientation 
 
  Strong work ethic and willingness to take initiative 
 
  Good attitude toward teamwork as well as the ability to work independently 
 
  Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize 
 
  Excellent time management 
 
  Working knowledge of Archer 
 
  Qualifications, Education, and Certification Requirements 
 
 
 Education :  bachelor’s degree (Graduate Degree encouraged) 
 
 
 Experience :  Banking compliance background and Previous Banking Experience is preferred 
 
 
 Certifications/Specific Knowledge :  Strong interpersonal skills, proficient computer skills, ability to multitask and prioritize projects. Working knowledge of Archer 
 
  TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES 
 
  Required annual compliance training; New Employee Orientation; Product Knowledge Class 
 
  PHYSICAL DEMANDS 
 
  Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, and reports. This position requires a large amount of time in front of a computer. This can be done sitting or standing with use of the right desk. 
 
  WORK ENVIRONMENT 
 
  This position is remote. 
 
  Telecommuting roles, no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. They must also have a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered. 
 
  TRAVEL 
 
  Travel may be required to come to meetings as needed.

f5e56f53d121bdd6.title: FOIA Analyst or Paralegal - FOIA - Remote
f5e56f53d121bdd6.desc:
Description: 
   The Gilchrist Law Firm has a great job opportunity to work with the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) and Litigation Support Services, Department of Energy (DOE). 
  Potential duties include but not limited to the following: 
 
 Provide support and expertise for FOIA litigation (including creating Vaughn indices, liaising with DOJ, and meeting court-imposed document production schedules). 
 Collect data in response to FOIA requests and protect Personally Identifiable Information by redacting information using Adobe Pro software and maintaining information in FOIAXpress e-discover tools and EDR document management. 
 Provide ad hoc and standard organizational support to include the gathering and compilation of information for the DOE and other government-wide calls for information. 
 Analyze data collected and create formal responses to requesters, Senior Management, Congress, and to the DOJ (e.g., FOIA Annual and Chief FOIA Officer Report). 
 Provide DOE leadership with sound, quantitative and qualitative bases for making decisions regarding policy, operational and strategic choices. 
 Track case progression against deadlines to ensure reduction of backlog. 
 Maintain regular contact with DOE FOIA/PA contacts; work with the GC to ensure appropriate exemption application and to craft legally sound responses. 
 Coordinate with the Office of Hearings and Appeals to resolve appeals and legal challenges concerning FOIA requests. 
 Maintain records that contain Personally Identifiable Information, confidential, administratively sensitive and controversial information; and develop, maintain, and streamline filing and tracking systems and procedures. 
 Conduct both formal and informal general correspondence. 
 Maintain and update FOIAXpress electronic files with current status updates and all file documentation. 
  Requirements: 
  
 Must possess a Bachelor’s Degree or paralegal certification/credential. 
 Must have two years of experience in support services and experience in analytical, administrative, and litigation support services, including advanced skill in processing records for release under the FOIA. 
 Must be familiar with processing records for release in discovery pursuant to litigation. 
 Must possess satisfactory ability to communicate orally and in writing to effectively assist, interpret, track and document legal casework. 
 MUST be experienced and proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite (to include Outlook, MS Word and Excel) Adobe Acrobat Pro, and FOIAXpress.

a5f097b86f2f6b2d.title: Senior Business Analyst (Fully Remote Job)
a5f097b86f2f6b2d.desc:
Job Detail 
 
 
 
 
 
     Job Code 61520
     
 
 
     Tax Term W2 Hourly1099
     
 
 
     Career Level Mid Level
     
 
 
     Experience 5 Years
     
 
 
     US Work Status US CitizenGreen Card HolderH-1B - Temporary Visa
     
 
 
     Job Duration 6 Months +
     
 
 
     Qualifications Bachelor's Degree 
     
 
 
 
 Job Description 
 
 
 Excelraise, LLC  is a rapidly growing full service IT solutions integrator and talent management company headquartered in  Denver, CO . Our valued client*s includes fortune 500 companies, Government Agencies. 
  Currently we are looking for a qualified individual to work as a  Senior Business Analyst (Fully Remote Job)  with our direct client   in  Hartford, CT . 
  ***This is 100% Full Time Remote position*** 
  Analyze and document business requirements and processes related to public sector service delivery for a single or multiple related State agencies. Formulate alternative solutions to satisfy these requirements, which may involve business process reengineering, and/or the deployment of information technology. Plan and/or conduct end user training for new applications. Prepare cost benefit analyses according to State CBA methodology. Develop and/or oversee plans for the execution of a solution from project inception to conclusion. Construct data models and activity/process models as may be required to define system functions. Provide support for the installation, testing, data conversion, implementation, and ongoing maintenance of information systems. Conduct and document the results of special studies dealing with systems and/or business process issues. Facilitate sessions to gather and document requirements and explore solutions. Superior negotiating, analytical, group facilitation, and relationship management skills. Work effectively with all levels of State staff from clerical through agency executive management. This includes skillful interviewing capability. Possess superior organizational and written/verbal communication skills. Hands-on Data Modeling and Process Modeling experience may be required for some assignments. 
  Basic Qualifications: 
 
 An ability to integrate solutions across multiple functional and technical environments is required. 
 Must hold a BA/BS degree. Same qualifications as Business Analyst I with the exception of the following: Requires a minimum of five years of increasingly complex and responsible experience in the last five years. Must hold a BA/BS degree (advanced degree a plus). 
 Prior experience working with Federal, State, or Local Government 
 experience evaluating RFP responses 
 business requirements for software systems 
 Industry Business Analysis certification a PLUS (PMI-BA, IIBA-CBAP, etc.) 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills in English 
 Prior experience supporting Public Health or a Health and Human Service Agency 
 Microsoft Office 
 
 
 
 Required skills 
 
 
  • business requirements for software systems evaluating RFP responses Federal Microsoft Office or Local Government Public Health or a Health and Human Service Agency state
